title: Equality is Symmetric
description:
Prove that equality is symmetric: if `x = y` then `y = x`.

**Goal:** `forall (A : Type) (x y : A), x = y -> y = x`

This is one of the fundamental properties of equality. In Coq, you can prove it using `rewrite` to substitute equals for equals.
hints: Use `intros` to introduce all variables and the equality hypothesis `H`
Use `rewrite H` to replace `x` with `y` (or `rewrite <- H` to go the other way) in the goal
After rewriting, the goal becomes `y = y` or `x = x`, which follows by `reflexivity`

solution:
Theorem eq_symmetry : forall (A : Type) (x y : A), x = y -> y = x.
Proof.
  intros A x y H.
  rewrite H.
  reflexivity.
Qed.
